cards.title: Camera preview is completely black (no video)
quickChecks: Click the icon on the left of the address bar → make sure Camera permission is set to 'Allow'
If another app (Zoom/Discord/OBS) is using the camera, close it
Refresh the page and allow the camera again

steps.label: Check permissions
steps.detail: Chrome: Settings → Privacy and security → Site settings → Camera → confirm this site is set to 'Allow'.

steps.label: Select the correct device
steps.detail: If you have multiple cameras, the wrong device may be selected. Providing a 'camera selector' UI/setting helps a lot.

steps.label: Close apps using the camera
steps.detail: If another app is using the camera, the browser may fail to access it (common on laptop built-in cameras).

steps.label: Check HTTPS / localhost
steps.detail: In some environments, getUserMedia works properly only on https or localhost.

cards.title: Camera still isn't detected even after allowing permission
quickChecks: Check if the site is saved as 'Blocked' in the browser settings
Test in an Incognito window (to rule out extension interference)
Also confirm OS-level camera permission (Windows/macOS)

steps.label: Reset site permission
steps.detail: Chrome: Click the lock icon → Site settings → Reset permissions, then reopen the site.

steps.label: Check OS privacy settings
steps.detail: Windows: Settings → Privacy & security → Camera / macOS: System Settings → Privacy & Security → Camera. Make sure the browser is allowed.

steps.label: Disable extensions
steps.detail: Ad blockers / security extensions can block media permissions. Temporarily disable them and test again.

cards.title: Camera/recognition doesn’t work well on mobile
quickChecks: This project targets PC (Windows) control, so desktop is the most stable environment
Mobile browsers / in-app webviews have many camera restrictions

steps.label: Open in an external browser
steps.detail: In-app browsers (WebView) like KakaoTalk/Instagram are restrictive. If possible, open in Chrome/Safari.

steps.label: Do final testing on PC
steps.detail: To verify gestures triggering OS input (mouse/keyboard), you need Windows + the local agent environment.

cards.title: Hand recognition doesn't work (camera shows video)
quickChecks: Recognition accuracy drops sharply in low light
If the hand leaves the frame, detection fails
If the tab is in the background, FPS/performance may drop

steps.label: Lighting / background
steps.detail: Turn on front lighting and keep the background simple (increase contrast between hand and background).

steps.label: Hand position in frame
steps.detail: Keep your hand near the center of the camera, not too close or too far.

steps.label: Performance / power mode
steps.detail: On laptops, power-saving mode can drastically reduce recognition. Use AC power / high-performance mode.

cards.title: Recognition is slow / laggy
quickChecks: Lowering resolution often improves performance a lot (e.g., 1280x720 → 640x480)
Close other tabs/extensions/apps to free CPU/GPU

steps.label: Lower resolution
steps.detail: Reduce width/height in getUserMedia constraints, or use 'ideal' with smaller values.

steps.label: Limit processing frequency
steps.detail: Instead of hard 30fps, limiting gesture/pointer processing to ~10–20fps can feel smoother.

steps.label: Lower model options
steps.detail: Reducing Hands settings (max hands / complexity) can improve speed.

cards.title: Camera works but the 'gesture cursor' doesn't respond
quickChecks: Check whether the local agent is running (Python/EXE)
Check whether the manager is connected to the agent (WS/local port)
Confirm the current mode is an input mode (MOUSE/DEFAULT, etc.)

steps.label: Run the agent
steps.detail: If the local agent is not running, the manager can show status but cannot generate real OS input.

steps.label: Check connection status
steps.detail: It’s recommended to show Agent: Connected/Disconnected status in the manager UI.

steps.label: Check mode
steps.detail: PRESENTATION/DRAW/VKEY behave differently—confirm the expected behavior matches the current mode.

cards.title: Camera error: NotFoundError
quickChecks: Confirm the camera is physically connected
Check Device Manager to ensure the camera isn't disabled

steps.label: Reconnect device
steps.detail: If using an external webcam, unplug/replug USB or try a different port.

steps.label: Check driver
steps.detail: If it’s a driver issue, you may need to reinstall the driver.

cards.title: Camera error: NotAllowedError
quickChecks: If you clicked 'Block' before, it may now be automatically blocked
Some managed PCs (company/school) may block cameras by policy

steps.label: Re-allow permission
steps.detail: Reset site permission, then refresh and allow again.

steps.label: Check policy restrictions
steps.detail: If an admin policy/security software blocks the camera, it may not be solvable from the browser alone.

cards.title: Camera error: OverconstrainedError
quickChecks: If requested resolution/FPS constraints are too strict, camera start can fail

steps.label: Relax constraints
steps.detail: Set width/height as 'ideal' or try lower values.

steps.label: Device limitations
steps.detail: Some laptops/webcams support limited resolutions—try stepping down gradually.

cards.title: Mirroring feels wrong and gesture directions are confusing
quickChecks: It’s safest to separate 'preview mirroring' from 'analysis coordinates'

steps.label: Mirror UI only
steps.detail: Apply transform: scaleX(-1) only to the display (video/canvas).

steps.label: Keep analysis on original
steps.detail: Keep landmark coordinates based on the original frame (consistent coordinate system).

cards.title: CORS blocked (Access-Control-Allow-Origin)
quickChecks: Frontend (5173) and backend allowed origins must match
If you use cookies/session, credentials settings must also match

steps.label: Backend CORS setup
steps.detail: Add http://localhost:5173 etc. to allowedOrigins.

steps.label: Match credentials
steps.detail: Frontend axios withCredentials=true ↔ backend allowCredentials(true).

steps.label: Vite proxy
steps.detail: In dev, proxying /api can bypass CORS.

cards.title: 404 Not Found (API path issue)
quickChecks: In DevTools Network, confirm the real request URL is /api/xxx
Check Spring controller mappings (@RequestMapping)

steps.label: Frontend baseURL
steps.detail: Verify axios baseURL/vite proxy correctly prefixes /api.

steps.label: Backend mapping
steps.detail: Make sure @RequestMapping('/api/...') matches the frontend call path exactly.

cards.title: 500 Internal Server Error (backend exception)
quickChecks: Check the backend console stacktrace from the top (root cause)
In Network, identify which API fails and inspect URL/request body

steps.label: Capture stacktrace
steps.detail: Fix based on the first/root exception: BeanCreation/NullPointer/SQL, etc.

steps.label: Validate request DTO
steps.detail: Field name mismatches can cause nulls and crashes. Freeze request/response schema.

cards.title: Auth issues: 401/403 (Unauthorized/Forbidden)
quickChecks: Confirm Authorization header (JWT) or cookies are actually sent
Check backend Security config: protected vs allowed paths

steps.label: Check headers in Network
steps.detail: Confirm Authorization: Bearer ... or Cookie is included in the request.

steps.label: Expiry / refresh
steps.detail: If the token is expired, you need a refresh flow or re-login.

steps.label: Role/authority
steps.detail: If an API is admin-only, confirm the user's role/authority matches.

cards.title: Axios requests go to the wrong server/port
quickChecks: Check axios baseURL config
Check vite.config.js proxy settings
Search code for hardcoded absolute URLs

steps.label: Confirm Vite proxy
steps.detail: In dev, /api → http://localhost:8080 proxy can be normal.

steps.label: Remove absolute URLs
steps.detail: Hardcoding http://localhost:8080 breaks across environments. Prefer relative paths (/api).

cards.title: Agent/server WebSocket connection fails
quickChecks: Confirm WS URL (ws/wss) matches the server endpoint
Make sure frontend/backend/agent ports are not mixed up
In deployment, reverse proxy (e.g., Nginx) must allow WS upgrade

steps.label: Check endpoint path
steps.detail: Match Spring WebSocket path (/ws etc.) and the client URL.

steps.label: Log events
steps.detail: Log onopen/onclose/onerror and server handshake logs to quickly find root cause.

steps.label: wss/https
steps.detail: On https, you must use wss. Also decide how to send auth/tokens.

cards.title: Mixed Content (https page calling http)
quickChecks: Browsers block calling http API/WS from an https page

steps.label: Match security level
steps.detail: In production, use https/wss for API/WS or hide behind the same-domain reverse proxy.

cards.title: JSON parsing error / response is HTML (Whitelabel)
quickChecks: Often you receive an error page (HTML) instead of an API JSON response, so JSON.parse fails

steps.label: Check Network response
steps.detail: Confirm whether the response starts with '{' or '<html>'.

steps.label: Check URL/proxy
steps.detail: If the request hits the wrong server/path, you may get HTML. Recheck baseURL/proxy/mappings.

cards.title: DB save/read doesn't work (data not inserted / not visible)
quickChecks: Confirm you're connected to the right DB (URL/schema/container)
Confirm transaction/commit happens
Check mapping mismatch (column names, nullable, enum)

steps.label: Check DB connection info
steps.detail: Verify application.yml datasource url/user/schema matches the currently running DB.

steps.label: Enable SQL logs
steps.detail: With Hibernate/JPA, enable SQL logs to see if insert/update actually runs.

steps.label: Migration/schema
steps.detail: After adding/renaming columns, if schema isn't updated, inserts may fail or values may be truncated.

cards.title: Slow response / timeout (including recognition/log upload)
quickChecks: Sending frames/logs too frequently can saturate server/network
If heavy work is synchronous, UI may freeze too

steps.label: Throttle frequency
steps.detail: Limit frame/status sending to ~5–10fps and send only on meaningful changes.

steps.label: Async / queue
steps.detail: Consider queueing heavy work and responding quickly (e.g., 202 Accepted).

steps.label: Reduce logging
steps.detail: Excess debug logs can severely hurt performance. Apply levels/sampling.

cards.title: Agent shows 'Disconnected' (manager can’t control locally)
quickChecks: Check whether the local agent (Python/EXE) is running
Check whether firewall/security blocks local ports
Check whether manager settings (agent host/port) are correct

steps.label: Verify agent is running
steps.detail: Check Task Manager / tray icon / console window to confirm the agent is running.

steps.label: Check port
steps.detail: Match the agent’s local port (e.g., ws://localhost:xxxx) with the manager settings.

steps.label: Firewall exception
steps.detail: Allow the app/port in Windows Firewall (it can block even local connections).

cards.title: Pressed Start but cursor/keyboard control doesn’t work
quickChecks: Windows accessibility/security permissions may block input control
Some environments require running as administrator
Check whether the current mode actually emits input

steps.label: Run as administrator
steps.detail: Running the agent as Administrator can make input hooks more reliable.

steps.label: AV/security exceptions
steps.detail: Security software may block keyboard/mouse automation. You may need to add an exception.

steps.label: Check mode
steps.detail: DEFAULT/MOUSE/VKEY/DRAW/PRESENTATION behave differently—match mode to expected behavior.

cards.title: Gestures are detected but the wrong action runs (mapping issue)
quickChecks: Confirm the mapping belongs to the current user/profile
Confirm mappings are separated by mode
Check if Left/Right hand detection is flipped

steps.label: Check mapping screen
steps.detail: Verify 'gesture → action' is applied for the current mode/profile.

steps.label: Separate by mode
steps.detail: If the same gesture triggers different actions per mode, define priority to prevent conflicts.

steps.label: Hand/coordinate 기준
steps.detail: If mirroring or Left/Right hand detection differs, mappings can appear flipped.

cards.title: Click/drag is too sensitive (many false triggers)
quickChecks: Without debounce/cooldown (e.g., 300–600ms), repeated detections cause many false triggers
You need thresholds and stabilization (hold frames)

steps.label: Apply cooldown
steps.detail: After executing a tap/click once, block re-execution for N ms.

steps.label: Stabilize for N frames
steps.detail: Confirm a gesture only if it persists for K consecutive frames (reduce jitter).

steps.label: Smoothing
steps.detail: Smooth cursor coordinates with EMA/moving average for better feel.

cards.title: PRESENTATION mode: next/prev slide doesn’t work
quickChecks: The presentation app window must be focused for hotkeys to work
Confirm the hotkey mapping matches the actual app (PowerPoint/Google Slides)

steps.label: Check focus
steps.detail: Click the presentation app window once to focus it, then test again.

steps.label: Hotkey mapping
steps.detail: Next: Right/PageDown/Space, Prev: Left/PageUp, etc. Map based on your environment.

steps.label: Fullscreen/slideshow
steps.detail: Some hotkeys work only in slideshow/presentation mode.

cards.title: VKEY (virtual keyboard): input is weird / not accumulating
quickChecks: Verify tap gesture signal (tapSeq) actually increments
Verify pointer coordinates align with key areas and scaling
Consider whether you need layout switching (QWERTY/Korean)

steps.label: Validate tap signal
steps.detail: Commit input only on tap events (hover-only commits cause many false inputs).

steps.label: Coordinate calibration
steps.detail: Aspect ratio differences between canvas/video can offset coordinates. Separate scale/offset for calibration.

steps.label: Key highlight sanity
steps.detail: UI highlight should match the actual key being committed—this makes debugging much easier.

cards.title: DRAW mode: strokes break or shake
quickChecks: Without coordinate smoothing, jitter shows up directly in strokes
Pen-down / pen-up detection may be unstable

steps.label: Coordinate smoothing
steps.detail: Stabilize pointer with EMA/Kalman filter/moving average.

steps.label: Pen-down detection
steps.detail: Confirm draw-start gesture after N stable frames, and apply cooldown.

steps.label: Check performance
steps.detail: Running canvas rendering + recognition together can raise CPU. Reduce resolution/frequency.

cards.title: RUSH/Game mode: too many misinputs (spam / dropped inputs)
quickChecks: If keydown/keyup timing is wrong, 'stuck key' happens
Games are sensitive to focus/permissions/security software

steps.label: Guarantee key-up
steps.detail: Ensure every keydown always has a keyup (also release on errors/mode switch).

steps.label: Rate limit policy
steps.detail: Limit presses per second and stabilize detection.

steps.label: Focus/fullscreen
steps.detail: If the game window loses focus, inputs may go elsewhere.

cards.title: Mode switch fails or behavior gets messed up after switching
quickChecks: Mode switching must synchronize state across server/manager/agent
You must cleanup timers/listeners and reset keydown states on switch

steps.label: Cleanup on switch
steps.detail: On mode change, 반드시 interval/animation loop/listeners cleanup을 해주세요.

steps.label: Reset input state
steps.detail: If dragging/keydown is active, force release on mode switch.

steps.label: Sync event
steps.detail: Send a reliable 'modeChanged' event from manager → agent and ideally receive an ACK.

cards.title: End-to-end diagnosis checklist (camera → recognition → agent → execution)
quickChecks: 1) Do you see the camera preview?
2) Do hand landmarks/pointer values change?
3) Is the agent status Connected?
4) Does the current mode match the expected behavior?
5) Is mapping applied to the current profile?
6) Do actual key/mouse inputs occur?

steps.label: 1) Camera
steps.detail: Check permissions/device/black-screen issues.

steps.label: 2) Recognition
steps.detail: Verify landmarks/pointer coordinates update in real time.

steps.label: 3) Agent
steps.detail: Check local port connection/firewall/running state.

steps.label: 4) Mode/Mapping
steps.detail: Verify mode/profile/gesture→action mappings.

steps.label: 5) Execution
steps.detail: Check focus/permissions/keydown-up/cooldown policies.
